text: barrio looks totally unrecognizable now... every corner's changed
old barrio cinema now just another supermarket história pisoteada
old neighborhood cinemas gone; now just flashy malls everywhere smh
Gotta improvise – park hangs over pubs any day!

hah tell me about it! started using old family recipes just so i can stretch pesos till next paycheck...makes u appreciate simple dishes y’know? lol throw some empanadas into the oven - cheaper than hitting up bars every Friday night, plus leftovers are pure gold
Late night drives - City lights soothe like nothing else...
ya know those moments after a downpour when streets get all quiet? feels almost sacred here che - everything just shiny & still for once, gives you time to breathe even if it's crazy busy most times
Lots overlook suburban myths tho... Hidden gems everywhere.

crazy how we just go on bout our days oblivious eh? where i do my rounds, there’s this unassuming corner...turns out was a crucial spot during political uproars back in the day - taxi drivers like me live history daily!
always thought old structures were just buildings till i started driving around towns here - learned each corner has its stories...makes you think huh

crazy stuff huh? reminds me when i found out we got whole streets named after historic figures who never even set foot here! talk bout putting someone on a pedestal they didn't ask for... just city things i guess 🤷‍♂️
idk man sometimes these stories are pumped up just to attract tourists – seen plenty as i cruise around town every day... Not everything dubbed 'historic' is legit when you peek behind the curtain.

dude driving cabs showed me real quick what being grown-up means.. those long shifts plus handling fares alone? yeah taught me more than any classroom ever did, things get real when you're dealing daily with all sorts of characters - some okay some plain loco

Back in school thought i'd have sports car by now... reality? More like steering wheel tan lines from driving all day y'know? Life throws curveballs but hey who says we can't still score some homeruns with surprising perks along way 😉👍
driving all day makes you dream of different horizons but yeah vacation days aren’t rolling in like fares at rush hour – still beats being stuck inside an office though haha
Ride-sharing booms during festivals here, gotta save extra then cuz slow months hit hard! Always track your fares & set aside something small daily – adds up quick!
gonna chip in here - some folks wanna stack cash high as obelisco but for me? eating well & zero debt's the jackpot. think happiness ain't just bout pesos-counting... gotta find your groove!

driving around wasn't exactly childhood dream stuff but hey gets you talking with all sorts man kinda grows on ya plus bills won’t pay themselves right? at least picking your own music’s a win gotta find those small victories wherever we can

fate's got a funny way huh? never dreamt i'd spend days behind the wheel when younger - visualized being on stage actually! still find joy chatting folks up & learning their stories though kinda like living multiple lives at once! plus nothing beats your own boss vibes tbh.
nudged towards divorce 'cause late-night fares clash hard w/ family plans
Long shifts driving people around means missing out on lotsa stuff - family dinners, friends' birthdays... ya adapt or drift apart. gotta find your balance or burnout hits you like BAM!
Always talking politics even when off duty - occupational hazard!
money talks in life for sure - driving does just that for me here but let's not forget passions outside work hours help keep us sane amid chaos of city streets!

back when i started driving cabs it was mostly dudes thinking they owned the roads...stopped counting how many times folks seemed surprised seeing women at the wheel. but hey those stereotypes are getting crushed daily now - more power you keep slaying out there!
u ever seen a cab driver knitting between fares? started as joke now its chill time + passengers get kick outta seeing hombre w/ yarn. got real good at scarves!
man driving all day here gives you lotsa time for thinking - folks got all sorts of expectations based on tradition but end up just doing whatever works for them when real life hits hard lol
turning 30 was chill for me—if anything folks respected me driving them 'round more

dynamics sure changed amigo..back when i started driving cabs full-time most pals were like me - main earners at home.. now i see all sorts round here mixing it up big time! gotta roll with whatever works for each family ain't that right?
here? nah man - Old ways die hard!
Mostly split bills down here too!
15 years down then kaput - ain't always at seven!
En las mías no hubo rascacielos pero se desinfló igual - each journey unique tho!
Solo road trips beat couple vacations – divorce perks?

totally get what you're saying - your roots kinda tag along for life's ride! for me though? stories pack more punch when shared from behind the wheel meeting all walks of life; paints richer pictures beyond any hometown frame.
gotta say tho cities that ain't all bright lights can still grab ya - born far from main streets yet traffic jams & soccer chats'bout Newell's scream home more than anything fancy ever could
always thought i’d miss Rosario more but driving through these busy streets every day, it’s like i carry its calm demeanor amid the chaos - keeps me sane when traffic gets nuts!
